sections.content: **Last Modified:** 11 Dec 2025
Introduction

Self service is an important option to offer to customers. Sometimes, customers would rather find a solution to their issue themselves, rather than connecting with a support team, and while the numbers vary slightly, on average one third of customers report wanting access to some self service options.

Within Desk, two features that greatly enable this self service functionality are Guided Conversations in conjunction with the ASAP widget. Guided Conversations allow for a team to build out a support process that, as the name suggests, guides a customer to a solution or next step in their support journey. The ASAP widget is an interface that not only contains these guided conversations, but a condensed version of a help center that can be embedded as a widget on the customer's website for use.
Objectives

items: Showcase and demonstrate the creation and use of Guided Conversations and the ASAP widget within Desk
Understand the building blocks and flow logic of Guided Conversations
Configure the ASAP widget to provide comprehensive self-service options

sections.content: Guided Conversations

Guided Conversations (GC) are interactive, conversational flows that guide customers through problem-solving processes, data collection, or decision trees. They provide a chat-like interface that feels natural while systematically gathering information or directing customers to solutions.
What Are Guided Conversations?

items: Interactive chatbot-style conversations that don't require live agents
Built using a visual flow builder with drag-and-drop blocks
Can collect information, provide answers, create tickets, or route to agents
Available through ASAP widget, standalone widget, or directly in Help Center
Can integrate with external systems via webhooks and APIs

sections.content: **Use Case:** Create a guided conversation for "Account Access Issues" that asks diagnostic questions (Forgot password? Account locked? New device?), provides appropriate solutions, and only creates a ticket if self-service options don't resolve the issue.
Blocks Library
Guided Conversations are built using blocks - pre-configured components that represent different conversation elements or actions.
**Common Block Types:**

items: **Message Block:** Display text messages to customers
**Question Block:** Ask questions and collect responses (text, number, email, phone, etc.)
**Button Block:** Present multiple choice options for customers to select
**Card Block:** Display rich content with images, titles, descriptions, and action buttons
**Knowledge Base Article Block:** Show relevant KB articles based on the conversation
**Create Ticket Block:** Automatically create a support ticket with collected information
**Transfer to Agent Block:** Hand off the conversation to a live agent
**API/Webhook Block:** Call external services or trigger integrations
**Condition Block:** Create branching logic based on customer responses
**Set Field Block:** Store collected information in variables for later use

sections.content: **Tip:** Use condition blocks to create dynamic flows that adapt based on customer responses. For example, if a customer selects "Billing Issue," route them to billing-specific questions and solutions.
Building a Guided Conversation

items: Navigate to **Setup > Channels > Guided Conversations**
Click **Add Guided Conversation**
Give your conversation a name and description
Define the starting trigger or welcome message
Drag blocks from the library onto the canvas
Connect blocks to create the conversation flow
Configure each block's properties (questions, button labels, conditions, etc.)
Test the conversation using the preview feature
Publish the conversation when ready

sections.content: Integrations
Guided Conversations can integrate with other systems and Zoho applications to provide dynamic, data-driven experiences:

items: **Zoho CRM:** Look up customer information, deals, or account details
**Zoho Invoice:** Check invoice status or payment history
**External APIs:** Verify account status, check inventory, or retrieve order information
**Custom Integrations:** Connect to your internal systems via webhooks

sections.content: **Example:** A guided conversation for "Order Status" can use an API integration to look up the customer's order number and display real-time shipping information without agent involvement.
Webhooks
Webhooks allow Guided Conversations to communicate with external systems in real-time:

items: Send data collected during the conversation to external systems
Trigger actions in other applications based on customer responses
Retrieve data from external sources to display in the conversation
Update records in third-party databases
Notify external teams or systems when specific conditions are met

sections.content: **Setting Up Webhooks:**

items: In the Guided Conversation builder, add a Webhook block
Configure the webhook URL (the endpoint you want to call)
Set the HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, etc.)
Map conversation variables to webhook payload fields
Configure authentication if required (API keys, OAuth, etc.)
Test the webhook to ensure proper connectivity
Handle the webhook response and use returned data in subsequent blocks

sections.content: **Important:** Webhooks execute in real-time during customer conversations. Ensure external endpoints respond quickly (under 5 seconds) to avoid conversation delays or timeouts.
Standalone GC Widget
While Guided Conversations are typically accessed through the ASAP widget, you can also embed them as standalone widgets on specific pages:

items: **Targeted Placement:** Place specific guided conversations on relevant pages (e.g., "Refund Request" GC on your refund policy page)
**Dedicated Experience:** Create a focused self-service experience without the full ASAP interface
**Custom Styling:** Customize the widget appearance to match your website design
**Embed Code:** Generate and embed a simple JavaScript snippet on your website

sections.content: **Use Case:** Embed a "Demo Request" guided conversation on your pricing page to collect lead information and schedule demos automatically.
ASAP (Zoho Assist Automated Platform)
ASAP is Zoho Desk's comprehensive self-service widget that can be embedded on your website to provide customers with instant access to support resources.
What is ASAP?
ASAP is an all-in-one customer support widget that combines multiple self-service features into a single interface:

items: Knowledge Base article search and browsing
Guided Conversations for interactive problem-solving
Live Chat to connect with agents
Answer Bot for AI-powered responses
Community forum access
Ticket submission forms
Customizable appearance and branding

sections.content: **Key Benefit:** ASAP provides a unified, always-available support interface that deflects tickets by helping customers find answers themselves before contacting support.
Configuring ASAP
Navigate to **Setup > Channels > ASAP** to configure your ASAP widget settings.
Help Center Visibility
Control which Knowledge Base articles and categories are visible within the ASAP widget:

items: **Public Articles:** Accessible to all visitors without authentication
**Private Articles:** Only visible to logged-in customers
**Category-Based Visibility:** Show or hide entire categories
**Department-Specific Content:** Display different articles based on department context
**Search Functionality:** Customers can search articles directly from ASAP

sections.content: **Best Practice:** Keep your most common support topics as public articles in ASAP. Reserve private articles for customer-specific information or sensitive content.
Module Association
Associate the ASAP widget with specific departments and configure which features are available:

items: **Department Selection:** Choose which department(s) the ASAP widget serves
**Feature Enablement:** Enable or disable specific ASAP features (Chat, GC, Answer Bot, Community)
**Ticket Creation:** Configure which module new tickets are created in (Tickets, Cases, etc.)
**Field Mapping:** Map ASAP form fields to Desk ticket fields

sections.content: Integrating Components in ASAP
The power of ASAP comes from integrating multiple support channels and features into one widget.
Chat
Enable live chat within ASAP to allow customers to connect with agents in real-time:

items: Toggle chat on/off in ASAP settings
Configure business hours for chat availability
Set up agent availability and routing
Customize pre-chat forms to collect customer information
Configure chat-to-ticket conversion for follow-up

sections.content: **Note:** Chat in ASAP can be powered by SalesIQ integration or Desk's native chat functionality depending on your configuration.
Guided Conversations (GC)
Add your Guided Conversations to ASAP so customers can access interactive support flows:

items: Select which Guided Conversations appear in ASAP
Organize GCs by category or topic
Set trigger conditions (show specific GCs based on page URL or customer data)
Configure GC priority and ordering in the ASAP interface

sections.content: **Use Case:** Display a "Troubleshooting Wi-Fi Issues" GC prominently in ASAP for an ISP, while keeping less common topics like "Change Billing Address" accessible but not featured.
Answer Bot
Integrate Zia's Answer Bot into ASAP to provide AI-powered responses based on your Knowledge Base:

items: Enable Answer Bot in ASAP settings
Configure confidence thresholds for article suggestions
Set up Answer Bot to appear when customers type questions
Allow Answer Bot to suggest articles before customers submit tickets
Track Answer Bot effectiveness through analytics

sections.content: **The Answer Bot Flow in ASAP:**

items: Customer opens ASAP and starts typing a question
Answer Bot analyzes the question and searches the Knowledge Base
Relevant articles are suggested in real-time
Customer can read suggested articles without leaving ASAP
If articles solve the issue, no ticket is created (ticket deflection)
If articles don't help, customer can proceed to create a ticket or start a chat

sections.content: **Ticket Deflection:** Answer Bot in ASAP is one of the most effective ticket deflection tools. Well-maintained Knowledge Base articles combined with Answer Bot can reduce ticket volume by 20-40%.
ASAP Customization
Customize the ASAP widget to match your brand and website design:

items: **Widget Position:** Choose where ASAP appears on your site (bottom-right, bottom-left, etc.)
**Colors and Branding:** Match your brand colors, logo, and fonts
**Welcome Message:** Customize the greeting customers see when opening ASAP
**Widget Icon:** Use a custom icon or the default ASAP icon
**Language:** Configure multiple languages for international support
**Display Rules:** Show or hide ASAP on specific pages based on URL patterns

sections.content: Embedding ASAP on Your Website

items: Navigate to **Setup > Channels > ASAP**
Configure all desired features and settings
Customize the appearance and branding
Copy the embed code (JavaScript snippet)
Paste the code into your website's HTML, typically before the closing </body> tag
Test the widget on your staging site before deploying to production
Monitor ASAP analytics to track usage and effectiveness

sections.content: **Important:** Ensure your website's Content Security Policy (CSP) allows scripts from Zoho domains. Some strict CSP configurations may block the ASAP widget from loading.
Best Practices

items: **Start Simple:** Begin with a few high-value Guided Conversations for your most common support issues
**Test Thoroughly:** Walk through every conversation path to ensure logic works correctly
**Keep Conversations Short:** Aim for 5-10 interactions maximum; long conversations have high abandonment rates
**Provide Escape Routes:** Always offer options to create a ticket or chat with an agent if self-service isn't working
**Monitor Analytics:** Track which GCs are used most, where customers drop off, and which lead to ticket creation
**Update Knowledge Base:** Ensure KB articles are current and well-written for Answer Bot effectiveness
**Mobile Optimization:** Test ASAP and GCs on mobile devices - many customers access support from phones
**Progressive Enhancement:** Start with basic ASAP features, add complexity gradually based on usage data

sections.content: Training Activities
Complete the following exercises to gain hands-on experience with Guided Conversations and ASAP:
Activity 1: Create a Guided Conversation

items: Navigate to **Setup > Channels > Guided Conversations**
Click **Add Guided Conversation**
Create a guided conversation for one of your departments (Example topics: Submitting Support Request, Feedback Submission, Account Access Issues, Product Demo Request)

Build the conversation flow using at least 5 different block types: Message block for welcome message, Question blocks to collect information (name, email, issue description), Button block for multiple choice options, Knowledge Base Article block to suggest relevant articles, Create Ticket block to generate a ticket with collected information
Add conditional logic: Use a Condition block to branch based on customer responses, Create different paths for different issue types
Configure a Transfer to Agent block as a fallback option
Test the conversation using the preview feature: Walk through every possible path, Verify data is collected correctly, Ensure tickets are created with proper information
Publish the guided conversation when testing is complete

sections.content: Activity 2: Configure ASAP Widget

items: Navigate to **Setup > Channels > ASAP**
Enable the following features in ASAP: Chat, Guided Conversations, Answer Bot, Knowledge Base access
Configure Help Center visibility: Select which KB categories should be visible, Ensure your test articles are accessible
Associate ASAP with your test department
Add the Guided Conversation you created in Activity 1 to ASAP
Customize ASAP appearance: Update colors to match your brand or preferences, Set a custom welcome message, Choose widget position
Configure Answer Bot settings: Enable Answer Bot for ASAP, Set confidence threshold for article suggestions
Copy the ASAP embed code
Test ASAP functionality: Use the preview feature or embed on a test page, Search for articles, Try the Guided Conversation, Test Answer Bot by typing questions, Verify Chat functionality

sections.content: **Step Beyond:** Begin looking at the Analytics module. Try to configure some custom reports, components, and dashboards to track ASAP usage, Guided Conversation completion rates, and ticket deflection metrics.
Activity 3: Advanced Guided Conversation (Optional)

items: Create a more advanced Guided Conversation that uses webhooks or API integration
Example: "Order Status Lookup" that calls an external API to retrieve order information
Set up a webhook block to call an external service (you can use a test API like https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/)
Map conversation variables to the webhook payload
Use the webhook response to display dynamic information to the customer
Add error handling for cases where the webhook fails or times out
Test the integration thoroughly

sections.content: Important Details Summary

items: **Guided Conversations:** Interactive, conversational flows for self-service problem-solving
**Blocks Library:** Pre-configured components (Message, Question, Button, Card, KB Article, Create Ticket, Transfer to Agent, Webhook, Condition, Set Field)
**Integrations:** Connect GCs with Zoho CRM, Invoice, external APIs, and internal systems
**Webhooks:** Real-time communication with external systems for data exchange
**Standalone GC Widget:** Embed specific guided conversations on targeted pages
**ASAP:** All-in-one self-service widget combining KB, GC, Chat, Answer Bot, Community
**Help Center Visibility:** Control which KB articles appear in ASAP (public vs private)
**Module Association:** Link ASAP to departments and configure feature availability
**Chat in ASAP:** Live agent communication with business hours and routing
**GC in ASAP:** Display guided conversations in the widget for easy customer access
**Answer Bot in ASAP:** AI-powered article suggestions for ticket deflection (20-40% reduction)
**Customization:** Brand ASAP with colors, logos, welcome messages, and positioning
**Best Practices:** Start simple, test thoroughly, keep conversations short, provide escape routes, monitor analytics

sections.content: Check Your Understanding
After completing this lesson, you should be able to:

items: Explain what Guided Conversations are and their benefits for self-service
Identify and use different block types in the Blocks Library
Build a complete Guided Conversation with multiple paths and conditional logic
Integrate Guided Conversations with external systems using webhooks
Configure webhook blocks with proper authentication and data mapping
Embed standalone GC widgets on specific website pages
Explain what ASAP is and how it combines multiple support features
Configure Help Center visibility settings in ASAP
Associate ASAP with departments and modules
Enable and configure Chat functionality in ASAP
Add Guided Conversations to the ASAP widget
Integrate Answer Bot into ASAP for AI-powered article suggestions
Customize ASAP appearance to match brand identity
Embed the ASAP widget on a website using the provided code
Understand ticket deflection and how Answer Bot contributes to it
Apply best practices for creating effective Guided Conversations
Test Guided Conversations thoroughly before publishing
Identify appropriate use cases for Guided Conversations vs live agent support
Monitor analytics to improve GC and ASAP effectiveness
